## IBM watsonx.ai and watsonx.governance
## Trending documentation
[**Supported foundation models** \\
A collection of open source and IBM foundation models are deployed in IBM watsonx.ai.](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/w-and-w/2.1.x?topic=solutions-supported-foundation-models) [**Supported connectors** \\
Add connections to a broad array of data sources for working with data in watsonx.ai.](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/w-and-w/2.1.x?topic=data-connectors) [**Video library** \\
Short videos for data scientists, data engineers, ML engineers, and prompt engineers to learn more.](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/SSLSRPV_2.2.x/wsj/getting-started/videos-cpd.html) [**watsonx community** \\
A community for AI architects and builders to learn, share ideas, and connect with others.](https://community.ibm.com/community/user/watsonx/home) [**IBM Support** \\
Get assistance for the IBM products, services and software you own.](https://www.ibm.com/support/entry/portal/support?lnk=ushpv18hcwh1&lnk2=support) [**watsonx as a Service** \\
watsonx on the IBM Cloud.](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx-as-a-service)

## IBM watsonx Orchestrate
## Recommended topics
[**Using agents in the chat** \\
Use AI agents in Orchestrate Chat to simplify tasks and workflows.](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/watson-orchestrate/base?topic=using-agents-in-chat) [**Uploading files during a conversation** \\
Upload documents in Orchestrate Chat to help agents give accurate, content-based answers.](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/watson-orchestrate/base?topic=chat-uploading-files-during-conversation) [**Providing feedback on agent responses** \\
Share feedback to help agents improve accuracy and relevance.](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/watson-orchestrate/base?topic=chat-providing-feedback-agent-responses)
## Discovering agents and tools
[**Discovering the catalog** \\
Browse the catalog to discover agents and tools that simplify your tasks.](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/watson-orchestrate/base?topic=discovering-catalog) [**Prebuilt agents** \\
Prebuilt agents help you get started quickly with intelligent automation.](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/watson-orchestrate/base?topic=catalog-prebuilt-agents) [**Prebuilt tools** \\
Use prebuilt tools to automate with consistency and ease.](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/watson-orchestrate/base?topic=catalog-prebuilt-tools) [**Discovering external partner agents** \\
Unlock new capabilities with external partner agents available in the catalog.](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/watson-orchestrate/base?topic=catalog-discovering-external-partner-agents) [**Connecting to apps from prebuilt agents** \\
Create secure integrations with external applications.](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/watson-orchestrate/base?topic=catalog-connecting-apps-from-prebuilt-agents)
## Building agents and tools
[**Building agents** \\
Create smarter agents that think, act, and respond to dynamic conditions.](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/watson-orchestrate/base?topic=building-agents) [**Building tools** \\
Tools empower agents to interact with external systems and retrieve information.](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/watson-orchestrate/base?topic=building-tools) [**Overview of the agent builder** \\
Agent Builder simplifies the process of building intelligent agents.](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/watson-orchestrate/base?topic=agents-overview-agent-builder) [**Creating an agent** \\
Create smart agents with ease, whether starting from scratch or using a template.](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/watson-orchestrate/base?topic=agents-creating) [**Creating flows** \\
Create flows that automate actions and logic powered by LLMs.](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/watson-orchestrate/base?topic=tools-creating-flows)
Shape the future of Watson Orchestrate by sharing your ideas.](https://watson-orchestrate.ideas.ibm.com/) [**Community** \\
Share and discover information in this forum for like-minded users.](https://community.ibm.com/community/user/automation/communities/community-home?CommunityKey=3ad46381-9535-462e-85c9-568b21f4b067)

# Installing on IBM watsonx Orchestrate On-premises
Last Updated: 2025-08-28
Learn how to install IBM watsonx Orchestrate on-premises for both IBM Cloud Pak for Data and IBM Software Hub environments. This guide provides version-specific instructions and compatibility matrices to ensure a smooth deployment. IBM Software Hub is a cloud-native platform designed to simplify the deployment, management, and monitoring of IBM solutions on Red Hat OpenShift.

This guide provides version-specific instructions and compatibility matrices to ensure a smooth deployment. IBM Software Hub is a cloud-native platform designed to simplify the deployment, management, and monitoring of IBM solutions on Red Hat OpenShift. It includes a centralized management interface, called IBM Software Hub Control Center that allows
you to manage multiple instances within a single cluster. The integrated web client enables seamless navigation across installed solutions. The installation steps vary depending on the version of IBM watsonx Orchestrate and the corresponding IBM Software Hub version. Use the table below to find the right guide for your setup:
| Version | Cluster | Installation instructions |
| --- | --- | --- |
Table 1. Available versions for IBM Software Hub.

Use the table below to find the right guide for your setup:
| Version | Cluster | Installation instructions |
| --- | --- | --- |
Table 1. Available versions for IBM Software Hub. Ensure compatibility between your IBM watsonx Orchestrate version, IBM Software Hub, and Red Hat OpenShift:
| watsonx Orchestrate version | IBM Software Hub version | Red Hat OpenShift version |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 5.2.1 | 5.2.x | 4.12, 4.14, 4.15, 4.16, 4.17, or 4.18 |
| 5.2.0 | 5.2.x | 4.12, 4.14, 4.15, 4.16, 4.17, or 4.18 |
| 5.1.3 | 5.1.x | 4.12, 4.14, 4.15, 4.16, 4.17, or 4.18 |
| 5.1.2 | 5.1.x | 4.12, 4.14, 4.15, 4.16, or 4.17 |
| 5.1.1 | 5.1.x | 4.12, 4.14, 4.15, 4.16, or 4.17 |
| 5.1.0 | 5.1.x | 4.12, 4.14, 4.15, 4.16, or 4.17 |
Table 2. Support matrix for IBM Software Hub. IBM Cloud Pak for Data is a Kubernetes based container platform that supports the modernization and automation of data and AI workloads.

Support matrix for IBM Software Hub. IBM Cloud Pak for Data is a Kubernetes based container platform that supports the modernization and automation of data and AI workloads. It enables deployment on your own infrastructure, helping reduce risk and improve data governance. Choose the appropriate installation guide based on your version of IBM watsonx Orchestrate and IBM Cloud Pak for Data:
| Version | Cluster | Installation instructions |
| --- | --- | --- |
Table 3. Available versions for IBM Cloud Pak for Data. Check the compatibility of your IBM watsonx Orchestrate version with IBM Cloud Pak for Data and Red Hat OpenShift:
| watsonx Orchestrate version | IBM Cloud Pak for Data version | Red Hat OpenShift version |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 5.0.3 | 5.0.x | 4.12, 4.14, 4.15, or 4.16 |
| 5.0.1 | 5.0.x | 4.12, 4.14, or 4.15 |
| 5.0.0 | 5.0.x | 4.12, 4.14, or 4.15 |
| 4.8.5 | 4.8.x | 4.12, 4.14, or 4.15 |
| 4.8.4 | 4.8.x | 4.12 or 4.14 |
Table 4. Support matrix for IBM Cloud Pak for Data.

Check the compatibility of your IBM watsonx Orchestrate version with IBM Cloud Pak for Data and Red Hat OpenShift:
| watsonx Orchestrate version | IBM Cloud Pak for Data version | Red Hat OpenShift version |
| --- | --- | --- |
| 5.0.3 | 5.0.x | 4.12, 4.14, 4.15, or 4.16 |
| 5.0.1 | 5.0.x | 4.12, 4.14, or 4.15 |
| 5.0.0 | 5.0.x | 4.12, 4.14, or 4.15 |
| 4.8.5 | 4.8.x | 4.12, 4.14, or 4.15 |
| 4.8.4 | 4.8.x | 4.12 or 4.14 |
Table 4. Support matrix for IBM Cloud Pak for Data. As other industry leaders join IBM in embracing the use of inclusive language, IBM will continue to update the documentation to reflect those changes.

# Getting started with IBM watsonx Orchestrate
Last Updated: 2025-09-12
IBM watsonx Orchestrate is an intuitive, AI-powered platform that you can use to create, configure, and deploy intelligent agents that can automate business tasks. Whether you're automating repetitive workflows or building
complex multi-agent systems, the platform is designed to support users of all skill levels.

Please try again later.
# Getting started with IBM watsonx Orchestrate
Last Updated: 2025-09-12
IBM watsonx Orchestrate is an intuitive, AI-powered platform that you can use to create, configure, and deploy intelligent agents that can automate business tasks. Whether you're automating repetitive workflows or building
complex multi-agent systems, the platform is designed to support users of all skill levels. With watsonx Orchestrate, you can:
- Build and deploy agents without writing code
- Automate tasks such as scheduling, data entry, and approvals
- Start small and scale up with advanced tools and integrations
- Explore the clean, guided UI that simplifies agent creation and management.

Whether you're automating repetitive workflows or building
complex multi-agent systems, the platform is designed to support users of all skill levels. With watsonx Orchestrate, you can:
- Build and deploy agents without writing code
- Automate tasks such as scheduling, data entry, and approvals
- Start small and scale up with advanced tools and integrations
- Explore the clean, guided UI that simplifies agent creation and management. Get a quick overview of how to use watsonx Orchestrate and learn the basics of creating your first AI agent:

An AI agent is a system that runs tasks on behalf of a user or another program, either autonomously or with minimal user input. These tasks are often triggered by specific events, and the agent reports outcomes back to the user or system. When agents interact with users, they learn optimal actions or make informed decisions. This learning process often uses reinforcement learning techniques, by enabling the agent to achieve a specific goal.

When agents interact with users, they learn optimal actions or make informed decisions. This learning process often uses reinforcement learning techniques, by enabling the agent to achieve a specific goal. With their ability to perceive, reason,
and act, agents can be strategically applied across domains such as finance, healthcare, and HR to enhance efficiency, customer experience, and business growth. You can interact with AI agents in several ways:
- Use prebuilt agents and external agents from the catalog to get started quickly.
- Create custom agents that use the no-code experience in the agent builder.
- Access shared agents directly from your chat interface if your team already deployed them. Explore the following sections to learn how to discover, create, and use AI agents effectively. Defining the roles of a team within a platform is key to clarifying responsibilities and boosting operational performance.

Explore the following sections to learn how to discover, create, and use AI agents effectively. Defining the roles of a team within a platform is key to clarifying responsibilities and boosting operational performance. On watsonx Orchestrate, each role contributes to the shared goal: building and using AI agents for business. Three roles form the foundation of the platform: admin, builder, and user. However, to help ensure cohesive operations and strategic alignment, a fourth role is also essential: the product expert. Know each one:
- **Admin:** The first member to join watsonx Orchestrate, the admin is responsible for granting user access and assigning roles.

However, to help ensure cohesive operations and strategic alignment, a fourth role is also essential: the product expert. Know each one:
- **Admin:** The first member to join watsonx Orchestrate, the admin is responsible for granting user access and assigning roles. They must ensure that the platform is properly configured and ready for building and using AI agents.
[Configuring the watsonx Orchestrate environment](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/watson-orchestrate/base?topic=getting-started-watsonx-orchestrate#configuring-the-sitedatakeywordwoshort-environment)
- **Builder:** The designer and creator of AI agents. Builders are responsible for developing agents that are tailored to specific business needs. They collaborate closely with users and admins to gather input and create solutions
that streamline workflows and boost productivity.

Builders are responsible for developing agents that are tailored to specific business needs. They collaborate closely with users and admins to gather input and create solutions
that streamline workflows and boost productivity. Go to [Building AI agents](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/watson-orchestrate/base?topic=getting-started-watsonx-orchestrate#building-ai-agents) to get started.
- **User:** The person who interacts with AI agents to complete tasks more quickly and efficiently. Their primary interface on the platform is Orchestrate Chat, which allows them to run tasks through a conversational and intuitive
experience. Go to [Using AI agents in the Orchestrate Chat](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/watson-orchestrate/base?topic=getting-started-watsonx-orchestrate#using-ai-agents-in-the-orchestrate-chat) to get started.
- **Product expert:** A versatile member who embodies all three core roles—admin, builder, and user.

Their primary interface on the platform is Orchestrate Chat, which allows them to run tasks through a conversational and intuitive
experience. Go to [Using AI agents in the Orchestrate Chat](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/watsonx/watson-orchestrate/base?topic=getting-started-watsonx-orchestrate#using-ai-agents-in-the-orchestrate-chat) to get started.
- **Product expert:** A versatile member who embodies all three core roles—admin, builder, and user. Product experts oversee the full agentic experience, from configuring administrative settings to orchestrating complex multi-agent
workflows. Their deep understanding of the platform ensures seamless integration and strategic alignment in the team. Are you a product expert? Complete the three learning paths to unlock your full potential. For more information about roles and its capabilities, see [Roles on IBM watsonx Orchestrate](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/SSAVQO/about/wo_personas.html).

Are you a product expert? Complete the three learning paths to unlock your full potential. For more information about roles and its capabilities, see [Roles on IBM watsonx Orchestrate](https://www.ibm.com/docs/en/SSAVQO/about/wo_personas.html). Some configurations are primordial to prepare the watsonx Orchestrate for the whole team, such as:
- Add users and define roles
- Configure connections and team credentials
- Configure the security of the instance in the platform. Among other administrative settings. Follow the next guide path and click each step to know all the admin's assignments and start working on watsonx Orchestrate. Figure 1: Guide path to configure the watsonx Orchestrate environment. With the agent builder, a no-code studio, it's possible to design agents from scratch or customize templates from prebuilt agents. Builders can create agents with knowledge sources, collaborative agents and tools, in addition to deploy and integrate
with external channels.

With the agent builder, a no-code studio, it's possible to design agents from scratch or customize templates from prebuilt agents. Builders can create agents with knowledge sources, collaborative agents and tools, in addition to deploy and integrate
with external channels. Follow the next guide path and click each step to know all the builder's assignments and start working on watsonx Orchestrate. Figure 2: Guide path to build agents. With the environment prepared and agents ready to go, the user needs to learn how to navigate and use the environment effectively, by using agents in the Orchestrate Chat to maximize productivity, resolve tasks, and get work done with optimal
performance. Follow the next guide path and click each step to know all the user's assignments and start working on watsonx Orchestrate. Figure 3: Guide path to use agents in the Orchestrate Chat.
